page.title: 03Housing in Feathersone
page.content: The majority of housing in this area is owned by the council.In the past the NCB owned much property but the old back to back terrace housing has been demolished.There has been urban renewal around the colliery with new semi-detached,terraces,maisonettes,and old folks bungalows.The new houses are built in the old street pattern. Some spaces have been cleared and left as grassed areas but others are still derelict.In the shopping street houses are found immediately behind the single row of shops.These are mainly modern houses in crescents,small terraces and cul-de-sacs. North Featherstone and Ackton have the oldest houses,farmhouses and small cottages built of stone mixed in with new council estates are built here.
